title: Week 1: December 29–January 4 - Introduction to the Old Testament
content:
# Old Testament Week 1: Jesus is in Old Testament Stories!

## Lesson Overview (for the teacher)
This lesson teaches little ones that Jesus Christ shows up in Old Testament symbols and stories, like manna and a shepherd, so they feel excited to find Him this year.

## Wiggle Activity (2-3 minutes)
**Happy March Time**  
March around the room while singing "If You're Happy and You Know It" with claps, stomps, and jumps. Yell "Jesus loves us!" at the end. Gets wiggles out fast!

## Simple Scripture
**"The Lord is my shepherd." (Psalm 23:1)**  
Say it together 3 times. Make motions: Point up for "Lord," hug self for "my," pat head like petting a sheep for "shepherd." Sing it to "Twinkle Twinkle" tune.

## Main Activities (15 minutes total)

### 1. Manna Surprise! (Object Lesson, 4 minutes)  
**Materials:** Soft bread pieces or crackers (one per child).  
**Steps:** 1. Hold up bread: "In Old Testament, God sent bread from heaven called manna!" 2. Give each child a piece to touch and nibble. 3. Say, "Jesus is our Bread of Life too! (John 6:35)."  
**What to say:** "Yum! God feeds us like He fed His people. Jesus is our special bread from heaven. Eat and smile for Jesus!"

### 2. Find Jesus Game! (Games, 4 minutes)  
**Materials:** Picture cards (lamb, bread, serpent on stick—draw simply or print). Hide 3 around room.  
**Steps:** 1. Hide cards before class. 2. Say "Ready, find Jesus helpers!" Kids hunt and bring back. 3. Cheer for each: "Lamb like Jesus! Bread like Jesus!" (Exodus 12:3–5; John 1:29).  
**What to say:** "Jesus hides in stories like a treasure hunt! Go find Him—whoopee!"

### 3. Shepherd Sheep Craft (Hands-On Crafts, 4 minutes)  
**Materials:** Paper plates, crayons, stickers (sheep faces).  
**Steps:** 1. Give plates. 2. Kids draw/color sheep and write/draw "Jesus is my shepherd." 3. Stick on room wall.  
**What to say:** "Color your sheep! Jesus watches us like a shepherd. (Psalm 23). Take it home to show families!"

### 4. Promise March (Music & Movement, 3 minutes)  
**Materials:** None.  
**Steps:** 1. March in circle holding hands. 2. Chant "I promise to follow Jesus!" with jumps. 3. Stop and high-five.  
**What to say:** "God makes promises with us, like in Old Testament! March and promise: 'I will find Jesus!'"

## Picture Time
Show **The Prophet Isaiah Foretells Christ’s Birth** by Harry Anderson (Gospel Art Book, picture of Isaiah writing about baby Jesus). Ask: "What baby do you see? Who is coming? How does it make you happy?" Point to baby Jesus.

## Song
**"Seek the Lord Early" (Children’s Songbook, 108)**  
Sing with actions: Reach high for "seek," clap for "early," wiggle like lambs for "find Him."

## Snack Idea
Crackers or bread bites—"Manna from heaven! Jesus is our Bread of Life (John 6:35). Thank Heavenly Father!"

## Testimony Moment
"Hold hands. I know Jesus is in Old Testament stories and loves each of you so much." Invite: "Say 'Jesus loves me!' Hug a friend."

## Teacher Survival Tips
1. Set a timer for each activity—kids love the "beep go!" signal.  
2. For wiggles, add surprise hugs or "freeze like sheep!"  
3. If a child disrupts, whisper "Help me find Jesus?" and give a job like card holder. Short and sweet wins!
